ngiemboon: Á tǎa ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, Samsoŋ gʉa tà ńkúu láʼa Timna, ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ múɔ manzwě na púɔ panzwě Filisi.
en: Samson went down to Timnah   and saw a young Philistine woman there.

ngiemboon: À la gÿo ḿbiŋ nzèm ńgɔɔn mbwó tá we pɔ́ má we ngie: «N gʉa na púɔ panzwě pie ée Timna ńgyá tsɔ̌ múɔ manzwě, á gwɔ́ múɔ Filisi, pi gʉa ńzɛ́te nò yé ńná né mèŋ.»
en: He went back and told his father and his mother, “I have seen a young Philistine woman in Timnah. Now get her for me as a wife.”

ngiemboon: Tá we pɔ́ má we zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgee tsetsɛ̀ɛ ngẅɛ̀ yege mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pégè, ńzága múɔ manzwě, tà ńgee pɔ́ láʼa pʉ̀a Filisi, éfaʼa manzwě tá é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé la te púʼu wɔ́b wɔ́? Samsoŋ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó tá we ngie: Gʉa ńdúɔ ńná né mèŋ, ńtí nue n gyá á kuʼu na mèŋ.
en: But his father and mother said to him, “Can’t you find a young woman among your relatives or among any of our people? Must you go to the uncircumcised Philistines for a wife? ”

ngiemboon: Tá we pɔ́ má we la te zsé ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ la táŋte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́; kwàʼ nénʉ́ mé la ne faʼa pɔ́ ndilétaŋ, ńtí pʉ̀a Filisi. Pɔ́ zɔ̌ laa fʉʼó ńne sáʼa láʼa Ésàlayɛ.
en: Now his father and mother did not know this was from the Lord,   who wanted the Philistines to provide an opportunity for a confrontation.  # 14:4 for a confrontation supplied for clarity At that time, the Philistines were ruling Israel.

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ pâ metá pé cwóŋ, ńgʉa né Timna. Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe nkáʼ metÿǒ melùʼ, múɔ púʼntʉ̀ kẅɛ, ńne ńtóo né mvfò Samsoŋ ńgiŋe ńgaʼte.
en: Samson went down to Timnah with his father and mother and came to the vineyards of Timnah. Suddenly a young lion came roaring at him,

ngiemboon: Azẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a leen ńkúu na Samsoŋ, á tyé pɔ́ mbwó sẅɛ̀ɛ táʼ, ḿbiŋ ńzáʼa púʼntʉ̀ wa kèm pʉ́a páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie à záʼa múɔ mvfó la. À la te shwóŋo tá we pɔ́ má we mmó gie á cʉate wɔ́.
en: the Spirit of the Lord came powerfully on   him, and he tore the lion apart with his bare hands as he might have torn a young goat. But he did not tell his father or mother what he had done.

ngiemboon: À la leen ńcwóŋ cwóŋ ńgʉa ńgɔɔn nò né manzwě, ńdɔg ńjÿó twó ye.
en: Then he went and spoke to the woman, because she seemed right to Samson.

ngiemboon: Á náʼa ńtɔ́g tsɔ́ púɔ mefʉ̀ʼ, á gíŋe ḿbiŋe Timna lélɔgɔ nzwě we ńgʉa. Ńkúu mánzsè, ńcʉa lélíe pfó púʼntʉ̀ ya. Ńgyá séme ŋwáʼ ŋɔ́ɔn mǒ, tà mbà á něŋ melwò.
en: After some time, when he returned to marry her, he left the road to see the lion’s carcass, and there was a swarm of bees with honey in the carcass.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńkaa tsɔ́ lekʉ̀a ńnéŋe lɔ́ɔn pwó ye, ńgiŋe ńjÿó ńgee. À la gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ tá we pɔ́ má we, ńná yɔb, pɔ́ kẅé ńjÿó. Táʼ, á ke te shwóŋo wɔ́b ngie lekʉ̀a ŋwáʼ ŋwɛ́ kẅɛɛ pɔ́ na pfó púʼntʉ̀ wɔ́.
en: He scooped some honey into his hands and ate it as he went along. When he came to his father and mother, he gave some to them and they ate it. But he did not tell them that he had scooped the honey from the lion’s carcass.

ngiemboon: Tá pa Samsoŋ gʉa mbʉ̀a pà nzwě míŋ we. Ńkúu wó, ńgÿo línɔ̀ɔn, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ páʼ kwò nkàŋnyìŋ laa fʉʼó ńgÿo.
en: His father went to visit the woman, and Samson prepared a feast there, as young men were accustomed to do.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńtsɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a móm tá, ńdɔg ńgÿo ngàŋakwò yé.
en: When the Philistines saw him, they brought thirty men to accompany him.

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: E sẅíŋte gẅí, pi zẅíŋ, m maʼa tàʼ kwálʉʼʉ́. Pi lɔɔn ńdɔg lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a sie mé ge ne zíŋe leluŋó, ńkeme kwálʉʼʉ́ ŋwɛ́, mbà n ge náa gẅí púɔnzsǒ móm tá né menzsǒ línɔ̀ɔn móm tá.
en: “Let me tell you a riddle,”   Samson said to them. “If you can explain it to me during the seven days of the feast and figure it out, I will give you thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothes.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńké te kwɔg, mbà pi zɔ ge cʉ́ʼ ná sɛ̌ shúm né mèŋ. Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Maʼa kwálʉʼʉ́ gù, peg ne ńzẅíʼte.»
en: But if you can’t explain it to me, you must give me thirty linen garments and thirty changes of clothes.”

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: So he said to them:

ngiemboon: Lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, pɔ́ gɔɔn mbwó nzwě Samsoŋ ngie: «Gʉa ńdʉte ndúm gù à kyɛ́ʼte kwálʉʼʉ́ wɛ̂, éshwóŋo wég, tà á té púʼu wɔ́, mbà peg ge púte gẅí lâ ngẅɛ̀ tá gù tuɔ mmɔ̌g. Pi kɔ̌ɔn ńtóŋo wég jʉʼɔɔn páʼa, éfaʼa pɔ́ létúʼ shúm ség ka?»
en: On the fourth   day they said to Samson’s wife, “Persuade your husband to explain the riddle to us, or we will burn you and your father’s family to death. Did you invite us here to rob us? ”

ngiemboon: Anzwě Samsoŋ kɔ́ʼ legwé, ńgiŋe ńdʉa, ńgʉa shwóŋo ndúm we ngie: Ɔ̀ te wɔ́ɔn kwoŋ, ɔ̀ ka maʼa kwálʉʼʉ́ né pʉ̀a láʼ pég, pɔ́ kaa kuʼu lékem wɔ́, ɔ̀ la te kyagte shwóŋo wɔ́b wɔ́. Táʼ Samsoŋ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie n ka te tá wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ má wɔ̀ɔn shwóŋ mbà n ge shwóŋ pɔ́ gú la?»
en: So Samson’s wife came to him, weeping, and said, “You hate me and don’t love me!   You told my people the riddle, but haven’t explained it to me.”

ngiemboon: Alínɔ̀ɔn la gwaa cʉ́me, á cʉ́ʼ ńgẅiin yé pɔ́ lélʉa. Alyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a la kuʼ, á leen ńké ńdaʼte zwě we kwálʉʼʉ́ ŋwɛ́, á nue á la gwaa gwɔ́ mbà zwě we pǔ ńgege yé tɛʼ. Á leen ńké ńgʉa ńkyɛ́ʼte shwóŋ mefɛ̌ pé.
en: She wept the whole seven days of the feast, and at last, on the seventh day, he explained it to her, because she had nagged him so much. Then she explained it to her people.

ngiemboon: Nèm la gwaa pyé na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a, epʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ gɔɔn né Samsoŋ ngie:
en: On the seventh day, before sunset, the men of the city said to him:

ngiemboon: Azẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a sẅɛ́ʼɛ na Samsoŋ, á cwóŋ ńgʉa né Ashÿekeloŋ. À la kúu wó, ńzẅé pʉ̀a móm tá, ésẅɛ menzsǒ mɔ́b, ńdɔg ńgÿo nzsǒ línɔ̀ɔn, ńdɔg ńtó ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ně ńkeme kwálʉʼʉ́ wa. Ńdɔgɔ gyáŋalóŋ, ńkwɔ́ʼ ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a tá we.
en: The Spirit of the Lord came powerfully on him, and he went down to Ashkelon and killed thirty of their men. He stripped them and gave their clothes to those who had explained the riddle. In a rage, Samson returned to his father’s house,

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na nzwě Samsoŋ, mé náa yé mbwó múɔ mbàŋa gẅie à laa lyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn ńgwɔ́ tá leluŋó we.
en: and his wife was given to one of the men who had accompanied him.
